intro: Anthodon undulatum, commonly known as the wavy anthodium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for ecological and horticultural study.
